com.jcraft.jsch

Interface Signature

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    SignatureDSA, SignatureECDSA, SignatureRSA

    public interface Signature
    Usually not to be used by applications. A generic signature algorithm, with key and some state of an ongoing signing or verification algorithm. (Methods for providing the key are given in the subinterfaces SignatureDSA, SignatureECDSA, SignatureRSA, which also have some more documentation.)
    Since:
    0.1.49

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void init()
      Initializes the signature object.
      byte[] sign()
      Signs the data given so far to the update(byte[]) method.
      void update(byte[] H)
      adds some more data to be signed/verified.
      boolean verify(byte[] sig)
      Verifies that the given signature is a correct signature.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init()
   throws Exception
        Initializes the signature object. (This can only do initialization which do not depend on whether signing or checking is done.)
        Throws:
        Exception

      • update

        void update(byte[] H)
     throws Exception
        adds some more data to be signed/verified.
        Parameters:
        H - the array containing the data to be signed/verified.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • verify

        boolean verify(byte[] sig)
        throws Exception
        Verifies that the given signature is a correct signature.
        Parameters:
        sig - an array containing the signature for the data given by update(byte[]).
        Returns:
        true if the signature is correct, false if the signature is not correct.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • sign

        byte[] sign()
     throws Exception
        Signs the data given so far to the update(byte[]) method.
        Returns:
        a signature for the data.
        Throws:
        Exception
